SENT.plain: Tumoral calcinosis (TC) is a rare condition involving large joints and rarely the spine
It is characterized by calcification and swelling of periarticular tissues
Caffey disease (CD) is defined by recurrent episodes of painful soft tissue swelling and cortical thickening of the underlying bones
It is a self-limited disease that occurs in the first year of life
We report the first association of CD and TC of the cervical spine in a 4-month-old boy
We suggest that TC occurred as a consequence of the repetitive reparative process that takes place in CD, adding the latter to the list of diseases that may secondarily produce TC
